content: It may be that the second account is attempting to use the SMTP server of the first account. you can check that by - click 'account settings' - highlight the account that doesn't work in left sidebar - now, in lower right side of screen, click the button for 'edit outgoing server' and see if it is the same email address as the account. if not, revert to prior screen and select the dropdown menu of outgoing server and select the appropriate SMTP server.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you for your suggestion. Although I've always used the same outgoing server address for both accounts, I tried different options as you suggested, but got the same response. :-(
creator: wayne.mackinnon

content:
I am unclear on you situation. If you have a newer PC, you can transfer 100% from the old to the new with these steps:

  1. start thunderbird on old PC
  2. click tools>export and then click 'open profile folder'
  3. exit thunderbird
  4. copy profile content to external media
  5. install thunderbird on new pc, downloaded from thunderbird.net
  6. in receiving PC, click help>troubleshootinginformation
  7. scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'
  8. exit thunderbird
  9. now, paste contents of exported profile, overlaying contents of profile.
  10. if there is a compatibilitie.ini file, delete it
  11. restart thunder

if The old PC was a POP account and you just want to copy some of the messages to a different PC, that is also possible. Please clarify you intent. Thanks
creator: davidsk

content: The add-on "Folder Colors" is no longer compatible with recent Thunderbird versions. You can customise the colours of folder icons: R-click on the folder > Properties > General Information > Icon Colour

content:
First, this is a peer-to-peer forum. That is, we have no authority on new features. If you wish, you can go to connect.mozilla.org, and click to the IDEAS section for Thunderbird and record your recommendation there. On your issue, Thunderbird is more complex, but it offers more options than all other email clients. One key feature is that you can set the font for your preference, yet not force recipients to see your font instead of their own preference. I did a summary of steps in a prior post, so I am including a link here to it. It may be useful. Let me know if any issues. 

  https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1462509
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks david. Your link (both) really help a lot. I was quite mad because spending hours on just change the font size. Forgive me if my previous post seems offensive.
creator: sunk67188

content: Assuming you are using Windows, look at menu item Tools | Settings | General | Incoming Mails. Play with the "Show an alert" settings to get what you like. You probably just need to uncheck "Use the system notification".
